flawed_nl_solution:
She goes through 1 bottle a month and she likes to stock up for the entire year, which is 12 months so she needs 1*12 = <<1*12=21>>21 bottles
Each bottle is $30 and she needs 21 bottles so they will cost 30*21 = $<<30*21=630>>630
The website offers a 30% discount off of her $630 purchase so the discount will be 0.3*630 = $<<30*0.01*630=189>>189
Her sunscreen costs $630 and her discount is 189 making her purchase total 630-189 = $<<630-189=441>>441
#### 441

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 21. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
